title: SaltsR Application

title: SaltsR Application
text: can install development version SaltsR GitHub :

title: SaltsR Application
text: SaltsR package provides application test calculations. interactive tool allows evaluate package’s output using ion chromatography data. launch application, simply run following command R: open SaltsR application, can input ion chromatography data use package’s functionality. Disclaimer - tool development authour take responsibilty.

title: SaltsR
text: SaltsR Online Application SaltsR package provides application test calculations. interactive tool allows evaluate package’s output using ion chromatography data. launch application, simply run following command R: open SaltsR application, can input ion chromatography data explore package’s functionality.

title: SaltsR
text: Use function following inputs perform salt balance. full outputs function shown underneath. --date calculations, please use Salts Content Calculator. Please raise issues SaltsR calculations Github issues page.
code: fun_salt_balance(sample_name = "Example",                  dry_g = 1,                  water_ml = 100,                  chloride_ppm = 50,                  nitrate_ppm = 30,                  sulfate_ppm = 20,                  sodium_ppm = 40,                  potassium_ppm = 10,                  calcium_ppm = 15,                  magnesium_ppm = 5) fun_salt_balance(sample_name = "Example",                  dry_g = 1,                  water_ml = 100,                  chloride_ppm = 50,                  nitrate_ppm = 30,                  sulfate_ppm = 20,                  sodium_ppm = 40,                  potassium_ppm = 10,                  calcium_ppm = 15,                  magnesium_ppm = 5) |> dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 151 #> $ sample_name                  <chr> "Example" #> $ dry_g                        <dbl> 1 #> $ water_ml                     <dbl> 100 #> $ chloride_ppm                 <dbl> 50 #> $ nitrate_ppm                  <dbl> 30 #> $ sulfate_ppm                  <dbl> 20 #> $ sodium_ppm                   <dbl> 40 #> $ potassium_ppm                <dbl> 10 #> $ calcium_ppm                  <dbl> 15 #> $ magnesium_ppm                <dbl> 5 #> $ chloride_mol                 <dbl> 0.141033 #> $ nitrate_mol                  <dbl> 0.04838327 #> $ sulfate_mol                  <dbl> 0.02081945 #> $ sodium_mol                   <dbl> 0.1739904 #> $ potassium_mol                <dbl> 0.02557656 #> $ calcium_mol                  <dbl> 0.03742702 #> $ magnesium_mol                <dbl> 0.0205719 #> $ chloride_wt                  <dbl> 0.005 #> $ nitrate_wt                   <dbl> 0.003 #> $ sulfate_wt                   <dbl> 0.002 #> $ sodium_wt                    <dbl> 0.004 #> $ potassium_wt                 <dbl> 0.001 #> $ calcium_wt                   <dbl> 0.0015 #> $ magnesium_wt                 <dbl> 5e-04 #> $ total_wt                     <dbl> 0.017 #> $ chloride_mEq                 <dbl> 141.033 #> $ nitrate_mEq title: Authors and Citation
text: Bhavesh Shah. Author, maintainer. Sebastiaan Godts. Author. Scott Orr. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Shah B, Godts S, Orr S (2025). SaltsR: SaltsR - Tools analysis salt formation data. R package version 0.1.0, https://bhavshah01.github.io/SaltsR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SaltsR: SaltsR - Tools for the analysis of salt formation data},   author = {Bhavesh Shah and Sebastiaan Godts and Scott Orr},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://bhavshah01.github.io/SaltsR/}, }

what: SaltsR - Tools for the analysis of salt formation data
title: SaltsR - Tools for the analysis of salt formation data
text: SaltsR data science tool designed support scientists, researchers, conservators, heritage managers protecting cultural heritage salt weathering. corrects ion chromatography data use Runsalt application (Price 2000; Bionda 2005), based calculations Godts et al. 2022. Additionally, Runsalt output files can uploaded tool generate graphical visualisations. --date calculations, please use Salts Content Calculator. Runsalt software: Prediction salt mixture behaviour changing climate conditions using ECOS thermodynamic model. KIK-IRPA PREDICT tools: Suite calculators hygroscopic moisture content, ion balance, climate data visualisation. SaltsR R package: Data science tools development interoperability Runsalt software. SaltsR Online Application: Online version SaltsR use package’s functionality. Disclaimer - tool development authour take responsibilty.

title: SaltsR - Tools for the analysis of salt formation data
text: Upload ion chromatography data Runsalt application. Return output Runsalt application. Review visualisations tables. Export analytical results.

text: Online version SaltsR package. can use interactive SaltsR application web browser: SaltsR Online Application https://oceanonline.shinyapps.io/SaltsRApp/

text: can install development version SaltsR GitHub :

title: SaltsR - Tools for the analysis of salt formation data
text: SaltsR Online Application SaltsR package provides application test calculations. interactive tool allows evaluate package’s output using ion chromatography data. launch application, simply run following command R: open SaltsR application, can input ion chromatography data use package’s functionality.

what: Read and tidy Runsalt output data — tidyRunsalt
title: Read and tidy Runsalt output data — tidyRunsalt
text: function reads Runsalt output file, processes , returns tidy dataframe. separates salt variable information, pivots data, adds columns relative humidity (RH) moles (mol).

title: Read and tidy Runsalt output data — tidyRunsalt
Read and tidy Runsalt output data — tidyRunsalt
text: file_path character string specifying path Runsalt output file. X_col character string specifying X column variable. Defaul "RH". Y_col character string specifying Y column variable. Defaul "mol". Temp_value numeric specifying temperature (C). Default 20.

title: Read and tidy Runsalt output data — tidyRunsalt
text: tibble columns: Salt type salt RH Relative Humidity mol Moles salt filename name input file

title: Read and tidy Runsalt output data — tidyRunsalt

what: Process multiple Runsalt output files in a folder — tidyRunsaltFolder
title: Process multiple Runsalt output files in a folder — tidyRunsaltFolder
text: function reads Runsalt output files specified folder, processes , returns combined tidy dataframe. applies tidyRunsalt logic file, handling potential errors, row-binds results single dataframe.

title: Process multiple Runsalt output files in a folder — tidyRunsaltFolder
Process multiple Runsalt output files in a folder — tidyRunsaltFolder
text: folder_path folder_path character string specifying path folder X_col character string specifying X column variable. Default "RH". Y_col character string specifying Y column variable. Default "mol". pattern character string specifying file pattern match.

title: Process multiple Runsalt output files in a folder — tidyRunsaltFolder
text: tibble columns: Salt type salt RH Relative Humidity (specified X_col) mol Moles salt (specified Y_col) filename name input file
